pageDescription: OS actions are used to interact with the player's current session.

comment.shortText:
Gets the config bot (formerly known as the player bot).
This is the bot that represents the player's browser tab.
comment.text: It is `tempLocal` and is used to configure various portals.

tags.text:
Get the config bot and set a username on it.
configBot.tags.username = "bob";
OS actions are used to interact with the player's current session.

comment.shortText: Hides the "chat bar" at the top of the screen in CasualOS.
Hides the "chat bar" at the top of the screen in CasualOS.

Shows the "chat bar" at the top of the screen in CasualOS, optionally using the given text as the placeholder.
Typing in the chat bar will send [`@onChatTyping`](tags:@onChatTyping) shouts and pressing Enter will send a [`@onChat`](tags:@onChat) shout and clear the chat bar.
the options that the chat bar should use.

Shows the "chat bar" at the top of the screen in CasualOS, optionally using the given text as the placeholder.
Typing in the chat bar will send {@tag @onChatTyping} shouts and pressing Enter will send a {@tag @onChat} shout and clear the chat bar.

Shows the "chat bar" at the top of the screen in CasualOS, optionally using the given text as the placeholder.
Typing in the chat bar will send [`@onChatTyping`](tags:@onChatTyping) shouts and pressing Enter will send a [`@onChat`](tags:@onChat) shout and clear the chat bar.

tags.text:
Show the chat bar with some placeholder text.
os.showChat("hello");

comment.shortText: the text that the chat bar should show as the placeholder.

Shows the "chat bar" at the top of the screen in CasualOS, optionally using the given text as the placeholder.
Typing in the chat bar will send {@tag @onChatTyping} shouts and pressing Enter will send a {@tag @onChat} shout and clear the chat bar.

tags.text:
Show the chat bar with some placeholder text.
os.showChat("hello");

comment.shortText: Converts the given geolocation to a [what3words](https://what3words.com/) address. Returns a promise that resolves with the 3 word address.
The latitude and longitude that should be converted to a 3 word address.
Converts the given geolocation to a [what3words](https://what3words.com/) address. Returns a promise that resolves with the 3 word address.
Gets the geographic location that the current device is at in the world.
comment.text: Returns a promise that resolves with the location.

comment.shortText: Gets the geographic location that the current device is at in the world.
comment.text: Returns a promise that resolves with the location.

comment.shortText: Closes the HTML popup modal.
Closes the HTML popup modal.
Shows some HTML to the player in a popup modal. This can be useful for loading a separate webpage or providing some formatted text.

tags.text:
Show a header with some text. os.showHtml(`

This is some text!

`);

Show a YouTube video.
os.showHtml(`
  <iframe
      width="560"
      height="315"
      src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/BHACKCNDMW8"
      frameborder="0"
      allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture"
      allowfullscreen>
  </iframe>
`);

comment.shortText: the HTML that should be shown to the user.
Shows some HTML to the player in a popup modal. This can be useful for loading a separate webpage or providing some formatted text.

tags.text:
Show a header with some text. os.showHtml(`

This is some text!

`);

Show a YouTube video.
os.showHtml(`
  <iframe
      width="560"
      height="315"
      src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/BHACKCNDMW8"
      frameborder="0"
      allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture"
      allowfullscreen>
  </iframe>
`);

comment.shortText: Loads the given inst into the current browser tab. When the inst is loaded, the [`@onInstJoined`](tags:@onInstJoined) shout will be triggered.
comment.text: Note that separate instances cannot interact directly. They must instead interact via super shouts

comment.shortText: the ID of the inst to load.
Loads the given inst into the current browser tab. When the inst is loaded, the {@tag @onInstJoined} shout will be triggered.
comment.text: Note that separate instances cannot interact directly. They must instead interact via super shouts

comment.shortText: Unloads the given inst from the current browser tab. When the inst is unloaded, the [`@onInstLeave`](tags:@onInstLeave) shout will be triggered.
the name of the inst to unload.
Unloads the given inst from the current browser tab. When the inst is unloaded, the {@tag @onInstLeave} shout will be triggered.
Gets information about the device that the player is using.
Gets information about the device that the player is using.
Attempts to enable collaboration features on the device.

tags.text:
Enable collaboration on this device.
await os.enableCollaboration();

comment.shortText: Attempts to enable collaboration features on the device.

tags.text:
Enable collaboration on this device.
await os.enableCollaboration();

comment.shortText: Gets whether the current session was loaded with collaborative features enabled.
comment.text:
When `true`, CasualOS will attempt to sync the `shared` (including `tempShared` and `remoteTempShared`) spaces with other players.
When `false`, CasualOS will treat all the shared spaces like they are all `tempLocal`.

comment.shortText: Gets whether the current session was loaded with collaborative features enabled.
comment.text:
When `true`, CasualOS will attempt to sync the `shared` (including `tempShared` and `remoteTempShared`) spaces with other players.
When `false`, CasualOS will treat all the shared spaces like they are all `tempLocal`.

comment.shortText: Gets information about the version of CasualOS.
Gets information about the version of CasualOS.

Gets the number of remotes that are viewing the current inst.
Optionally takes a parameter which is the inst that the number of remotes should be retrieved for.
If omitted, then the current inst will be checked. Returns a promise that resolves with the number of active remotes.
the name of the inst that the number of remotes should be retrieved for. If not specified, then the current inst current inst will be used.

Gets the number of remotes that are viewing the current inst.
Optionally takes a parameter which is the inst that the number of remotes should be retrieved for.
If omitted, then the current inst will be checked. Returns a promise that resolves with the number of active remotes.
Gets the list of remote IDs that are connected to the current inst. Returns a promise that resolves with the list of remote IDs.
comment.text: The resolved list will always have at least one value that represents the current remote.

comment.shortText: Gets the list of remote IDs that are connected to the current inst. Returns a promise that resolves with the list of remote IDs.
comment.text: The resolved list will always have at least one value that represents the current remote.

comment.shortText: Gets the number of devices that are connected to the server. Returns a promise that resolves with the number of active devices.
Gets the number of devices that are connected to the server. Returns a promise that resolves with the number of active devices.
Applies the given updates to the current inst. Returns a promise that resolves once the updates have been applied.
comment.text:
Note that you can call this function with the same update multiple times and you will end up with only one version of the bots saved in the update. Additionally, future changes to the bots will be preserved even if the update is applied again.

This feature makes inst updates useful when you want to ensure that an experience starts in an initial state but also able to change over time.

tags.text:
Apply an update that was saved to a tag
await os.applyUpdatesToInst([ tags.savedUpdate ]);

comment.shortText: the list of updates that should be applied to this inst.
Applies the given updates to the current inst. Returns a promise that resolves once the updates have been applied.
comment.text:
Note that you can call this function with the same update multiple times and you will end up with only one version of the bots saved in the update. Additionally, future changes to the bots will be preserved even if the update is applied again.

This feature makes inst updates useful when you want to ensure that an experience starts in an initial state but also able to change over time.

tags.text:
Apply an update that was saved to a tag
await os.applyUpdatesToInst([ tags.savedUpdate ]);

comment.shortText: Creates an inst update that, when applied, ensures the given bots are created on this inst. Returns a promise that resolves with the inst update.
comment.text:
Note that you can apply the same update multiple times and you will end up with only one version of the bots saved in the update. Additionally, future changes to the bots will be preserved even if the update is applied again.

This feature makes inst updates useful when you want to ensure that an experience starts in an initial state but also able to change over time.

Unlike [`os.getCurrentInstUpdate()`](ref:os.getCurrentInstUpdate), this function creates an update that is not linked to this inst. This means that applying the update to the inst it was created in will create duplicate bots.

comment.shortText: the list of bots that should be included in the update.
Creates an inst update that, when applied, ensures the given bots are created on this inst. Returns a promise that resolves with the inst update.
comment.text:
Note that you can apply the same update multiple times and you will end up with only one version of the bots saved in the update. Additionally, future changes to the bots will be preserved even if the update is applied again.

This feature makes inst updates useful when you want to ensure that an experience starts in an initial state but also able to change over time.

Unlike {@link os.getCurrentInstUpdate}, this function creates an update that is not linked to this inst. This means that applying the update to the inst it was created in will create duplicate bots.

comment.shortText: Retrieves an inst update that represents the current local shared state of the inst. Returns a promise that resolves with the update.
comment.text:
Note that the inst update only contains bots and tag masks from the `shared` space. Useful for saving the current shared state of the inst so that it can be restored later or transferred to another inst.

Unlike [`os.createInitializationUpdate(bots)`](ref:os.createInitializationUpdate), this function creates an update that is linked to this inst. This means that applying the update to the inst it was created in will not create duplicate bots. It is still possible to apply the update to other insts, but it may create duplicate bots depending on the history of the other inst.

comment.shortText: Retrieves an inst update that represents the current local shared state of the inst. Returns a promise that resolves with the update.
comment.text:
Note that the inst update only contains bots and tag masks from the `shared` space. Useful for saving the current shared state of the inst so that it can be restored later or transferred to another inst.

Unlike {@link os.createInitializationUpdate}, this function creates an update that is linked to this inst. This means that applying the update to the inst it was created in will not create duplicate bots. It is still possible to apply the update to other insts, but it may create duplicate bots depending on the history of the other inst.

comment.shortText: Calculates the inst state from the given list of updates. Returns a promise that resolves with the bot state that the updates produce.
comment.text: Useful for tracking the history of an inst over time.

comment.shortText: The updates that the state should be calculated from.
Calculates the inst state from the given list of updates. Returns a promise that resolves with the bot state that the updates produce.
comment.text: Useful for tracking the history of an inst over time.

comment.shortText: Gets the list of updates that have occurred in the shared space. Returns a promise that resolves with the list of updates.
comment.text: Useful when combined with [`os.getInstStateFromUpdates(updates)`](ref:os.getInstStateFromUpdates) to track the history of an inst over time.

tags.text:
Get a list of updates to shared space
const updates = await os.listInstUpdates();

comment.shortText: Gets the list of updates that have occurred in the shared space. Returns a promise that resolves with the list of updates.
comment.text: Useful when combined with {@link os.getInstStateFromUpdates} to track the history of an inst over time.

tags.text:
Get a list of updates to shared space
const updates = await os.listInstUpdates();

comment.shortText: Disables the wake lock that was previously enabled. Returns a promise that resolves once the wake lock has been disabled.

tags.text:
Disable the wake lock
await os.disableWakeLock();

comment.shortText: Disables the wake lock that was previously enabled. Returns a promise that resolves once the wake lock has been disabled.

tags.text:
Disable the wake lock
await os.disableWakeLock();

comment.shortText: Retrieves the current wake lock state. Returns a promise that resolves with an object that contains information about the current wake lock state.
Retrieves the current wake lock state. Returns a promise that resolves with an object that contains information about the current wake lock state.

Requests a wake lock that will keep the device screen awake.
This will ask the user for permission to keep the screen awake.
Returns a promise that resolves once the wake lock has been granted. If the wake lock is denied, then an error will be thrown.
comment.text: Useful for a kiosk mode where the screen is always supposed to be on.

tags.text:
Request a wake lock from the user.
await os.requestWakeLock();

comment.shortText:
Requests a wake lock that will keep the device screen awake.
This will ask the user for permission to keep the screen awake.
Returns a promise that resolves once the wake lock has been granted. If the wake lock is denied, then an error will be thrown.
comment.text: Useful for a kiosk mode where the screen is always supposed to be on.

tags.text:
Request a wake lock from the user.
await os.requestWakeLock();

comment.shortText:
Instructs CasualOS to open the built-in developer console.
The dev console provides easy access to error messages and debug logs for formulas and actions.

Instructs CasualOS to open the built-in developer console.
The dev console provides easy access to error messages and debug logs for formulas and actions.

Send a [command](https://jitsi.github.io/handbook/docs/dev-guide/dev-guide-iframe-commands) to the Jitsi Meet API. The commands are only valid if the meet portal is fully loaded (see [`@onMeetLoaded`](tags:@onMeetLoaded)).
comment.text: Returns a promise that resolves when the command has been executed.

tags.text:
Change user's meet display name
os.meetCommand('displayName', 'ABC123');

comment.shortText: the command to execute.
The arguments for the command (if any).

Send a [command](https://jitsi.github.io/handbook/docs/dev-guide/dev-guide-iframe-commands) to the Jitsi Meet API. The commands are only valid if the meet portal is fully loaded (see {@tag @onMeetLoaded}).
comment.text: Returns a promise that resolves when the command has been executed.

tags.text:
Change user's meet display name
os.meetCommand('displayName', 'ABC123');

comment.shortText: Executes the given [function](https://jitsi.github.io/handbook/docs/dev-guide/dev-guide-iframe-functions) on the Jitsi Meet API and returns a promise that resolves with the result. The functions are only valid if the meet portal is fully loaded (see @onMeetLoaded).

tags.text:
Get a list of all the participants.
const participants = await os.meetFunction('getParticipantsInfo')

Get a list of available breakout rooms.
const rooms = await os.meetFunction('listBreakoutRooms');

comment.shortText: the name of the function to execute.
the arguments to provide to the function.

Executes the given [function](https://jitsi.github.io/handbook/docs/dev-guide/dev-guide-iframe-functions) on the Jitsi Meet API and returns a promise that resolves with the result. The functions are only valid if the meet portal is fully loaded (see @onMeetLoaded).

tags.text:
Get a list of all the participants.
const participants = await os.meetFunction('getParticipantsInfo')

Get a list of available breakout rooms.
const rooms = await os.meetFunction('listBreakoutRooms');

comment.shortText:
Gets the number of frames that have occurred over the last second.
Returns a promise that resolves with the number of frames that have ocurred in the last second.

tags.text:
Get the current frames per second.
let fps = await os.getAverageFrameRate();

comment.shortText:
Gets the number of frames that have occurred over the last second.
Returns a promise that resolves with the number of frames that have ocurred in the last second.

tags.text:
Get the current frames per second.
let fps = await os.getAverageFrameRate();

comment.shortText: Gets permission from user to access audio and/or video streams from the device.
comment.text:
Returns a promise that resolves if the user grants the specified media permission(s).
If the user blocks permission or has previously blocked permission or any other problem occurs, an error will be thrown.

comment.shortText: The options that should be used for requesting media permissions. At least one of `audio` or `video` must be set to `true`.
Gets permission from user to access audio and/or video streams from the device.
comment.text:
Returns a promise that resolves if the user grants the specified media permission(s).
If the user blocks permission or has previously blocked permission or any other problem occurs, an error will be thrown.

comment.shortText: Logs the given data to the developer console.

tags.text:
Log "Hello, World!" to the browser developer console.
os.log("Hello, World!");

comment.shortText: the data that should be logged.
Logs the given data to the developer console.

tags.text:
Log "Hello, World!" to the browser developer console.
os.log("Hello, World!");

comment.shortText:
Runs the given script.
The script will be executed in a separate environment with no `bot`, `tags`, `this`, `thisBot`, `data`, and `that` variables.
This means that you need to use the [`getBot(...filters)`](ref:getbot-filters) or [`getBots(...filters)`](ref:getbots-filters) functions to read bot data.
comment.text: Returns a promise that resolves with the returned script value after it has been executed.

tags.text:
Run a script that says "hello".
os.run("os.toast('hello');");

Run a script from the #script tag on the current bot.
os.run(tags.script);

comment.shortText: The script that should be executed.

Runs the given script.
The script will be executed in a separate environment with no `bot`, `tags`, `this`, `thisBot`, `data`, and `that` variables.
This means that you need to use the {@link getbot-filters} or {@link getbots-filters} functions to read bot data.
comment.text: Returns a promise that resolves with the returned script value after it has been executed.

tags.text:
Run a script that says "hello".
os.run("os.toast('hello');");

Run a script from the #script tag on the current bot.
os.run(tags.script);

comment.shortText:
Copies the given text to the player's clipboard. On Chrome and Firefox, this will act like a `Ctrl+C`/`Cmd+C`.
On Safari and all iOS browsers this will open a popup which prompts the player to copy the text.

tags.text:
Copy "hello" to the player's clipboard.
os.setClipboard("hello");

comment.shortText: the text that should be copied to the player's clipboard.

Copies the given text to the player's clipboard. On Chrome and Firefox, this will act like a `Ctrl+C`/`Cmd+C`.
On Safari and all iOS browsers this will open a popup which prompts the player to copy the text.

tags.text:
Copy "hello" to the player's clipboard.
os.setClipboard("hello");

comment.shortText: Shares the given URL or text via the device's social share capabilities. Returns a Promise that resolves when sharing has succeeded or failed.
the options for sharing.
Shares the given URL or text via the device's social share capabilities. Returns a Promise that resolves when sharing has succeeded or failed.
Waits the amount of time provided, in [miliseconds](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Millisecond).
comment.text: Returns a promise that resolves when the time has been waited.

comment.shortText: the Time to wait in ms. 1 second is 1000 ms.
Waits the amount of time provided, in [miliseconds](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Millisecond).
comment.text: Returns a promise that resolves when the time has been waited.

comment.shortText:
Shows a temporary "toast" notification to the player at the bottom of the screen with the given message.
Optionally accepts a duration parameter which is the number of seconds that the message should be on the screen.

tags.text:
Show the player a code for 5 seconds.
os.toast("this is the code", 5);

comment.shortText: the text that the toast message should show.
the number of seconds that the message should be on the screen. (Default is 2)

Shows a temporary "toast" notification to the player at the bottom of the screen with the given message.
Optionally accepts a duration parameter which is the number of seconds that the message should be on the screen.

tags.text:
Show the player a code for 5 seconds.
os.toast("this is the code", 5);
